title: Honoring Louis Aidala, Esq. upon the occasion of his designation as recipient of the Person of the Year Award by The Kings County Criminal Bar Association
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION honoring Louis Aidala, Esq. upon the occasion of
his designation as recipient of the Person of  the  Year  Award  by  The
Kings County Criminal Bar Association

WHEREAS,  Individuals  who give of their time and energies and serve the
best interests of their communities are an asset beyond remuneration and
cannot be sufficiently extolled; and
  WHEREAS, Louis Aidala, Esq. has given not only of his time  and  ener-
gies  but also of his competence, intelligence and leadership and conse-
quently has been designated for special honor; and
  WHEREAS, This Legislative Body is justly proud to honor Louis  Aidala,
Esq.  upon the occasion of his designation as recipient of the Person of
the Year Award by The Kings County Criminal Bar Association to be  cele-
brated  at  its  2011  Annual Dinner Dance held on Saturday, February 5,
2011, at Russo's On The Bay in Howard Beach, New York; and
  WHEREAS, Son of Arthur and  Marietta  Aidala,  Louis  Aidala  attended
Fordham Preparatory School and later Fordham University; he attended New
York University of Law and graduated in 1963; and
  WHEREAS. After graduation Louis Aidala was hired at the New York Coun-
ty  District  Attorney's Office where he worked as an Assistant District
Attorney until he was drafted into the Army during the  Vietnam  War  in
1966;  upon  his discharge from the United States Army with the esteemed
rank of Captain, he returned to the District Attorney's office where  he
remained  until  he embarked upon the world of private practice in 1972;
and
  WHEREAS, At the outset of the Attica riot, Louis Aidala was  appointed
Special  Prosecutor  for  the  New  York  State Attorney General; at the
conclusion of the trial, he returned to private practice, and  over  the
past  four  decades,  has  tried  dozens  of cases both at the State and
Federal Levels, as well as written and argued a  multitude  of  appeals;
and
  WHEREAS,  Louis Aidala has been called upon to contribute his time and
talents to countless civic and charitable endeavors and has always given
of himself unstintingly; and
  WHEREAS, Louis Aidala is proud of his involvement in a number  of  Bar
Associations, particularly the Columbian Lawyers Association of which he
has been a long-time member of the Board of Directors; and
  WHEREAS,  With him throughout have been his wife of 47 years, Mary Ann
and their two loving children, Arthur and Lori, as well as  their  three
grandchildren, Luca, Nicholas, and Julianna, all of whom feel privileged
to be a part of his life and rejoice in his achievements; and
  WHEREAS,  A singular asset to all of the citizens he has served in the
community of the State of New York, Louis Aidala's life and career are a
portrait of preeminence in public service and present a role  model  for
all who aspire to a career in public service; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
honor Louis Aidala, Esq. upon the occasion of his designation as recipi-
ent of the Person of the Year Award by The  Kings  County  Criminal  Bar
Association; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Louis Aidala, Esq.
